img.title: Elementary Staff
img.style: left: 124px; top: 115px; width: 513px; height: 416px; border-width: 6px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(255, 0, 0);

div.span: New School Office Hours Due to COVID-10

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
span.br: Effective Monday, April 20, all school buildings/offices will be available to the public Monday - Thursday from 7:30 am to 4:00 pm and closed on Fridays.

br.span: Kindergarten round-up will be held via Zoom on Friday, April 24th at 6:00 pm. The meeting is for all Kindergarten age children. The Zoom app is free to download. If you would like to attend the meeting, please email tonyasmith@usd463.org or jenniferharness@usd463.org so they can send you the code and links. This meeting will include enrollment information, as well as kindergarten expectation information.
Cowley College Offering Free Courses in May

Cowley College is offering free tuition in May for all Cowley County and Sumner County residents under CATS (Community Appreciation Tuition Scholarship). There are numerous four week courses offered. Visit Cowley's website at www.cowley.edu/communityscholarship to apply for courses and for more information on what is available.

span.span:
All USD 463 employees have rights pertaining to leave of absence under the Families First Coronavirus Response Act. For full information, click on the link below:
FFCRA Poster Non-Federal.pdf

br.span: Food Service Update for Free School Meals

Free grab and go breakfast and lunch meals will continue to be offered for our students, but a few updates were made to the program. If you have any questions, please contact Julie Wilson at the district office (620-782-3355). Click the link below to read the latest updates:
Middle/High School Students Zoom Meeting Information

All high school and middle school teachers have scheduled times to meet with students and answer questions through Zoom during this online learning time. Click the links below to view the full schedule by teacher and course:
HS Zoom Meeting Times.pdf
MS Zoom Meeting Times.docx

div.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); white-space: pre-wrap;

div.span: Please know that even though Governor Kelly placed a stay at home order for the state of Kansas, school will still continue as directed. The Continuous Learning will still take place. Please plan on your child completing the work assigned. Thank you.

span.span: As of today, all playground equipment at the elementary school is closed to the public until further notice. They should be locked up. Please respect the closure as it is important to combat the corona virus.

br.span: Congrats to the 2020-21 Middle School Cheer Team!

Congratulations to the following girls for making the 2020-21 middle school cheer team:
Cayenne Ault, Jasmine Bohaty, Kenadie Carter, Allie Clasen, Aliya Hopper, Chloe Lacey, Hailey Southern, Hailey Wilson
USD 463 Closed for the Remainder of the School Year

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; font-size: 18px;

p.span: At 4:00 today, March 17, Governor Laura Kelly announced the closing of all Kansas schools through the remainder of the school year. With this recommendation as well as our own concern for the safety and well-being of our students and families, USD 463 Udall Schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. The district will be providing continual learning opportunities based on support from KSDE and with the guidelines provided by KDHE.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; font-size: 18px;

p.span: We understand this brings many questions and concerns from our community. District Leadership in partnership with the Board of Education and KSDE has started working through our next steps as a district.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; font-size: 18px;

p.span: Here is what we know now:

p.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;
p.span: USD 463 will continue to work with KSDE to provide meals to students of Udall Schools

p.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.span: Udall School will work next week to develop curriculum and lessons from KSDE guidelines to provide Udall students with continuing learning opportunities
USD 463 plans to host parent meetings Wednesday March 18,
Thursday March 19, and Friday March 20, at the high school.
Details of these meetings will be shared in another document
that will be posted on the school website and the school

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; font-size: 18px;

p.span: We ask for your patience as we navigate this unprecedented situation and work through additional details. As we have more specifics about what services we will be able to provide for families in need during this closure, we will communicate through or regular means.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

span.span: The KSHSAA is committed to the safety of our student-participants and the health of our school communities. Accordingly, in response to

regarding the closure and cessation of in-person instruction in all Kansas schools through May 29, 2020, the KSHSAA is cancelling all spring championships, competitions, and festivals for the remainder of this school year. The KSHSAA recognizes the value of school activities for all students and school communities, but the current situation does not permit the opportunity for school activities to take place in a manner that is consistent with the very reason school activities exist.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
p.span: As a commitment to the health of Kansas students and communities, the best decision and only reasonable response is to cancel the regular season and post-season spring activity season. We all have an important responsibility to minimize community transmission as we embrace suggested precautions regarding COVID-19. As educators, the primary focus for our students and families is the health and well-being of each student. This action by the KSHSAA supports that effort across Kansas.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
p.span: The KSHSAA strongly discourages non-school activity participation at this time in an effort to mitigate the community transmission of the coronavirus. All CDC, KDHE and KSDE recommendations for preventing disease transmission should be followed at this time for any non-school activity in which a student participates. The following links provide access to those resources:

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

div.li: The Kansas School Safety Hotline (877-626-8203) is available for use by students, parents, and community members in anonymously reporting any impending school violence. Let's keep Kansas kids safe!
